measures.file_handling — Saving/Loading Measure Results from Disk¶

This module provides helper function to manipulate the files that store serialized measure results and graphs. It allows to check the existence of folders and to harmonize the file names.

measures.file_handling.format_net_states_file_name(measure_title, combination_number, iter_number)[source]¶

Formats the file name for the saving of network states.

Parameters:
  • measure_title (string) – the name of the measure/experimentations
  • combination_number (int) – the counter of the network simulations (useful when many network simulations are made, with may different parameter combinations)
  • iter_number (int) – the counter of the specific iteration being saved
Returns:

The file name formatted using the provided arguments.
Return type:

string
measures.file_handling.format_results_file_name(measure_title, combination_number, nb_iters)[source]¶

Formats the file name for the results of simulations

Parameters:
  • measure_title (string) – the name of the measure/experimentations
  • combination_number (int) – the counter of the network simulations (useful when many network simulations are made, with may different parameter combinations)
  • nb_iters (int) – the number of iterations that were run for each combination
Returns:

The file name formatted using the provided arguments.
Return type:

string
measures.file_handling.load_measures_results(folder, file_name)[source]¶

Load simulation results previously saved (pickled) into a file and returns the contents.

It is allowed to specify the absolute path, file name included, in the file_name argument (that is, folder may be an empty string). The converse is also true: the file name argument can be empty if provided in the folder one.

Parameters:
  • folder (string) – the folder in which to search for the binary files of the pickled.
  • file_name (string) – the name of the file to load (typically, a .pickle).
Returns:

the unpickled contents of the file(s) specified
Return type:

any
measures.file_handling.matchstring_net_states_file_name(measure_title)[source]¶

Gives the regex string of the file name for simulation results.

This function is analogous to matchstring_results_file_name().

Parameters:measure_title (string) – the name of the measure/experimentations
Returns:The regex string where the combination counter and iteration counter are left as (d+) allowing to catch them in a Python match object.
Return type:string
measures.file_handling.matchstring_results_file_name(measure_title)[source]¶

Gives the regex string of the file name for simulation results.

This function is useful to allow the search of files on the disk, and at the same time get information on which parameter combination these results refer to.

Parameters:measure_title (string) – the name of the measure/experimentations
Returns:The regex string where the combination counter and number of iterations are left as (d+) allowing to catch them in a Python match object.
Return type:string
measures.file_handling.prepare_file_name(folder, file_name, default_folder='/tmp/', default_file_name='unknown', extension='.pickle', overwrite_existing=False)[source]¶

Processes a file name and folder and outputs a canonic absolute path.

This function takes an absolute path, under the form of a folder and a file name (note: the full path can be in one of the two, the other one being an empty string or None), and processes this path so that: if no file name is provided, the default file name is used; if no folder is provided, the default one is used; if the file name does not have an extension (or an invalid one), append the provided extension to the file name; if the new file should not overwrite and existing one, then append a random string to the file name.

This function is meant to process the file names of files for graphs, simulation results, and network states alike.

This function also creates the folder(s) if necessary.

Parameters:
  • folder (string) – the folder in which the file should be saved.
  • file_name (string) – the name of the file that must be saved.
  • default_folder (string, option) – The default folder, if no folder is provided in argument (Default: /tmp)
  • default_file_name (string, option) – The default file name, if no folder is provided in argument (Default: unknown)
Returns:

a well formated full absolute path, where it is ensured that the folders in the basename all exist.
Return type:

string
measures.file_handling.save_graphs_simulation_results(plot_object, folder=None, file_name=None, overwrite_existing=False)[source]¶

Save a generated graphs in a png file.

The folder and file_name arguments are passed on to prepare_file_name(), with default folder /tmp/protocol_graphs/.

Parameters:
  • plot_object – a matplotlib object on which savefig() can be called, and containing the graph to save
  • folder (string, optional) – the folder in which to save the graph (Default: None)
  • (string, optional (file_name) – the name of the file to save the graph to (Default: None)
  • overwrite_existing (bool, optional) – whether, if the file_name provided already exists in the specified folder, it should be overwritten or not (default: False)
measures.file_handling.save_measures_results(sims_outputs, folder=None, file_name=None, overwrite_existing=False)[source]¶

This function saves the output produced by measures by pickling the results into a file on the disk.

The folder and file_name arguments are passed on to prepare_file_name(), with default folder /tmp/protocol_stats/.

Parameters:
  • sims_outputs (any) – the results of the measures and simulations. Must be serializable with the :mod:`dill package.
  • folder (string, optional) – the folder in which to place the binary files of the pickled object (Default: None)
  • file_name (string, optional) – the name of the file to save the data to (Default: None)
  • overwrite_existing (bool, optional) – whether, if the file_name provided already exists in the specified folder, it should be overwritten or not (default: False)
Returns
sim_outputs
measures.file_handling.save_network_state(network_manager, folder=None, file_name=None, overwrite_existing=False)[source]¶

Pickle and save on disk a NetworkManager instance.

Parameters:
  • network_manager (NetworkManager) – the network manager object, containing all the network state.
  • folder (string, optional) – the folder in which to save the network state (Default: None)
  • (string, optional (file_name) – the name of the file to save the network state to (Default: None)
  • overwrite_existing (bool, optional) – whether, if the file_name provided already exists in the specified folder, it should be overwritten or not (default: False)
Returns:

network_manager
